comments:
I am getting the following NullPointerException from PlatformActivator.run()

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:60)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.runApplication(EclipseAppLauncher.java:92)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAppLauncher.start(EclipseAppLauncher.java:68)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:400)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64)
        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)

Are you sure you are using Eclipse 3.1.2 ? From the trace it seems like you are using 3.2 or above.

If it is 3.2, the exception happens as org.eclipse.core.runtime plugin can't find the extension point org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications which is a bit strange as the extension point is defined in this very same plugin.

I would suggest the following:
- If running Eclipse from a command line, run once with "-clean" option. If running from PDE, open your launch configuration, switch to the "Configuration" tab, and select "Clean the configuration area before launching"
- Make sure you don't use Eclipse 3.1.2 for hosting while using runtime plugins from 3.2 for development (or as a target). If it is, use either 3.1.x plugins in both host and target or 3.2.x plugins in both host and target.

If this won't help, please provide details on how you launch Eclipse.

Hello,

We can't reproduce the problem anymore.


Regards,
Jack
